sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The doctrine of passive obedience and jure divino disproved and obedience to the present government, proved from Scripture, law, and reason. Written for the satisfaction of all those who are dissatisfyed at the present government: by a lay-man of the Church of England. Harrison, T. (Thomas), fl. 1683-1711.
1 sheet ([2] p.)
printed for Randal Taylor near Stationers-Hall, [London : 1689]
Imprint from colophon. A lay-man of the Church of England = Thomas Harrison. Cf. Wing. Formerly Wing H1848. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

printed for Randal Taylor near Stationers-Hall, [London : 1689]
